channel.title: Weird Windows Vista error message
channel.description:
Well, I have been having massive amounts of issues with my laptop lately. First, it over heats. And now it freezes on start up (probably caused by the overheating). So I took it up to the local Geek Squad to see if they had any solutions for it. They wanted to see exactly what was happening. So the first thing it does on start up, is load an error message that neither I, or any of the Geek Squad employs had seen before. The error was something like this.
Error loading winboot.exe Press ctrl+alt+delete to restañ.
Notice the "restañ." My opinion, Bill Gates was secretly kidnapped by Mexicans in hopes he can help them take over the world, and this is his way of saying help.

item.title: Weird Windows Vista error message
item.dc:creator: @Tree_Climber Tree_Climber
item.description:
@Tree_Climber wrote:

m.dog311:

Hahahaha. Geek Squad called today and had me come pick it up. It was infact a defective hard drive, and I’m glad it was. Originally it was a 120 gb harddrive. It’s 500 gb now. Awsome. No extra charge or anything.

they’re scamming you.

Read full topic

item.title: Weird Windows Vista error message
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Did you ever try creating a new user account?
And does it work fine in safe mode?

This has happened twice to me now, whole of windows explorer and all other applications just freeze, creating a new user and transferring all my stuff over to it worked fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Weird Windows Vista error message
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:13, topic:297824”]This is nothing to do with a fucked up hard drive. Vista has a new way to load your boot files, which OS is choosed upon startup, sometime’s it corrupts so installing an OS like Windows 7 would solve the problem, or even using your Vista install disc would do the trick.

The first of the 2 worked for me when I had to fix a friends computer.[/quote]

They must have removed that executable in the Win7 bootloader, because I do not have a winboot.exe.

Like, I said in my previous post, DO NOT SEND DISK TO GEEK SQUAD.
Just recover files like Newty said.

Read full topic

item.title: Weird Windows Vista error message
item.dc:creator: @Dineweedqu Dineweedqu
item.description:
@Dineweedqu wrote:

i have a 32 bit vista premium, i seem to keep overheating, it’s fucking weird.

item.title: Weird Windows Vista error message
item.dc:creator: @the1337legend the1337legend
item.description:
@the1337legend wrote:

omg ahaha lol i rofl’d so hard irl at your assumption, yes i have the same problem except for the error message, my laptop stopped freeezing on start up now idk why, i use it more as ewll, just sometimes i find it shuts off and wont turn on and needs the battery to be taken out, hold power button for 10 seconds put battery back in and it works ;o

vista fails

Read full topic

item.title: Weird Windows Vista error message
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

This is nothing to do with a fucked up hard drive. Vista has a new way to load your boot files, which OS is choosed upon startup, sometime’s it corrupts so installing an OS like Windows 7 would solve the problem, or even using your Vista install disc would do the trick.

The first of the 2 worked for me when I had to fix a friends computer.

Read full topic

item.title: Weird Windows Vista error message
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“Noobie22, post:11, topic:297824”][quote author=Tree_Climber link=topic=394187.msg2931862#msg2931862 date=1251327542]
I lold at the believing that winboot.exe existed.
[/quote]

It’s a good name for a virus, tbh.

Some newfag would suspect it as no problem, just a problem in the registry.[/quote]
There’s also svchost.exe which is harder to locate.

Read full topic

item.title: Weird Windows Vista error message
item.dc:creator: @noobie22 Noobie22
item.description:
@noobie22 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:8, topic:297824”]winboot.exe is not part of any Windows distrobution and is part of some spyware.

spyware website:

winboot.exe is an executable file that is responsible for launching parasites, loading main components of malicious programs and running a destructive payload. It is a significant part of a dangerous parasite, but can also function as a stand-alone threat. DO NOT run this file![/quote]

FAIL.

m.dog, May I ask what you have been downloading recently?

Read full topic

item.title: Weird Windows Vista error message
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

First, get a Linux Live CD (Do not install it onto hard disk) then mount the Windows partition and delete winboot.exe. (Its good to back a back-up, just incase it is a important executable)

winboot.exe is not part of any Windows distrobution and is part of some spyware.

winboot.exe is an executable file that is responsible for launching parasites, loading main components of malicious programs and running a destructive payload. It is a significant part of a dangerous parasite, but can also function as a stand-alone threat. DO NOT run this file!

I think that the Geek Squad, know that this is a problem and just want to replace the hard disk for fun. At least try and delete this file before sending it off.

Read full topic

item.title: Weird Windows Vista error message
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

I do lol. I got a call from Geek Squad. They think the hard drive is corrupted. Thankfully that is a hardware malfunction and my laptop is still under warrenty. So basically I get a free hard drive replacement. But for some reason ASUS (makers of the laptop) won’t let the repair be done in the store eventhough it is simple as fuck. So I think i might own an apple wanna-be…

Read full topic

My opinion, Bill Gates was secretly kidnapped by Mexicans in hopes he can help them take over the world, and this is his way of saying help.[/quote]Thats funny, I’ve had some recent overheating also.

item.title: Weird Windows Vista error message
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote="`Alec, post:1, topic:297825"][quote author=ziplock link=topic=394187.msg2930634#msg2930634 date=1251246820]
Install another OS like Ubuntu and load the windows partition and stick winboot.exe back in there where it belongs… I suggest Google, that’s where I go to fix all this crap.

My opinion, Bill Gates was secretly kidnapped by Mexicans in hopes he can help them take over the world, and this is his way of saying help.

This has been my hunch for awhile now… We must travel to Mexico to start the investigation!
[/quote]

Nah thats the cover up story, hes really being hidden by asians in a secret underground location. The one claiming to be bill gates is a fake.[/quote]Yea. The real one got owned in the face with a pie.
